text: Jodi's tree frog (Zhangixalus jodiae) is a frog. Scientists have seen it in exactly one place: a forest that is in Cao Ma and Ta Van in Ha Giang Province, Vietnam. The adult male frog is about 36.1â€“39.8 mm long from nose to rear end. The skin of the frog's back is green in color with no spots. The sides of the frog's body are cream-white in color. There is black color on the back legs and where the front legs meet the body. ==References== Category:Frogs of Asia
title: Zhangixalus jodiae
